65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:42): 03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac: however, that spec is going into Last Call, I would suggest you should review and get others (Catfish_Man, maybe dethbakin and mitz) to try to review too
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (02:42): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I was planning on it
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:42): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Yeah I know (I've logged some). I need to find time to do some hacking myself for it too. :)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:43): ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee: that is welcome as well
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:43): I need to schedule a meeting with the VoiceOver people to talk about ARIA
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:44): lemme know if you have other things that might be worth discussing with or mentioning to them
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:44): I think a lot of HTML5 elements will help with accessibility
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:44): proper use of <section> / <article> could allow for better navigation
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:44): I dunno how focused they are on accessibility in the browser though, relative to native apps

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:46): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: From a webkit perspective, I'd say making navigation from bit to bit around the page more predictable is the most important (but unfortunately probably the trickiest) thing.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:46): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Then there are some showstopper bugs like multiple selects being broken to the extent that they can't be read.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:46): Table support of some sort would be good.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:47): Another thing would be the ability to skip links.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:47): VO users sometimes complain about not being able to get to the meat of pages quick enough.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:47): I dunno what you mean about the multiple selects
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:47): I think being able to skip groups of links (as you can with JAWS and WE)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:47): would help with that
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:48): (Obviously HTML5 nav could help in the future too.)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:48): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15817
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:49): (for the multiple select bug)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:50): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Skipping links would also be good for non-VO users (keyboard/switch users)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:51): ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee: what defines a "group of links"?

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:52): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Good question :) In the case of WE and JAWS, you can set a threshold number of non-link characters between links for something to still count as a group of links (I assume that's to cope with pipe characters used in navigation)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:53): "you can set a threshold" would probably not be an acceptable answer for Mac OS X human interface

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:53): so say you set 3 as a threshhold ... <a href="...">foo</a> | <a href="...">baz</a> is part of a group but <a href="...">foo</a> and also <a href="...">baz</a> is not.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:53): but series of links w/ no more than some number of characters in between is sorta reasonable
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:53): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Well you could devise some sort of algorithm to do something similar I guess.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:53): I guess we could have a shortcut for that when tab to links is on
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:54): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: "tab to links" just switches the keybindings round
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:54): it doesn't actually change functionality
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:54): so I'm not sure why one would restrict the functionality to one keybinding scenario or another
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:55): (especially as that would complicate further a feature I've already had to attempt to explain more than once on macvisionaries)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:55): I don't think it makes sense to have a "tab skipping group of links" shortcut when not in "tab to links" mode
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:56): (can't remember if full keyboard access still enables tabbing to links by default)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:56): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Why not have an option tab skipping group of links
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:56): when in option tab to links mode
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:56): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I don't /think/ it does. I'm pretty sure I have to set that manually.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:56): well, it would have to be an obscure shortcut
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:57): if you have one to suggest we can consider it
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:57): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: With JAWS you just press N
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:58): tab, option-tab, shift-tab and shift-option-tab are all taken
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:58): granted you can't use N in the main UI though!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:58): I don't think we'd add a keyboard shortcut on an unmodified key in the default UI
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:58): yep ... my point is more that obscure is not necessarily better
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:59): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I suppose one thing to discuss is whether you could use a VO-prefixed shortcut (ctrl option) in the main UI space

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:59): the real problems are first, having a good shortcut, second figuring out how to make it reasonable discoverable, and third, figuring out what to call the feature
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:59): "skip group of links" is not a very clear name
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (02:59): since the default setting in the normal UI is that focus navigation skips all links
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:59): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: It's a lot clearer than what the WE manual calls it!
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (02:59): "Skip to text" IIRC
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:00): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Skip navigation might be better.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:00): (since that's the basic idea)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:00): so this is supposed to be a heuristic to skip what are intended to be groups of navigation links?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:00): to get to the main content faster?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:01): I think a heuristic for voiceover to skip to main content might be the best solution for this use case
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:01): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: That's the main purpose (although you can also have subsidiary groups of links scattered through the page)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:01): e.g. tag links following a blog entry
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:02): (or social media sharing links etc.)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:03): I'd say getting to the main content is roughly 70% of the need.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:04): (very roughly)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:04): Getting to the main content may be even harder to create a reliable algorithm for, however.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:12): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Another thing would be fixing the context menu so it can be operated with VO as in other apps.
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:12): one of the reasons for that is so that users can add bookmarklets easily
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:13): (which requires activating the context menu and selecting Add Link
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:13): ... that's another thing that came up on macvisionaries
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:13): (sorry this list is a bit random)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:13): there's a bug filed for context menu and it has a radar

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:15): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: oh another big thing: fix read all, so people can sit back, relax and have a webpage read to them :) http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15487
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:22): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: This was another bug that came out of discussions on macvisionaries: http://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=15310
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:22): (allow folks to select ranges of text with the keyboard)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:23): does VoiceOver have a standard mechanism for keyboard selection of non-editable text?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:24): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Not sure. Where else do you find non-editable documents that you'd want to copy?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:25): don't those both use WebKit for display too?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:25): IRC clients
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:25): ironically all these things tend to use WebKit
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:25): but that's an implementation detail
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:26): many alerts also have the error text selectable
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:26): iChat didn't use WebKit before Leopard
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:28): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: As far as I can tell, in Tiger, text is selectable in a plain text msg in Mail but not an HTML msg.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:29): ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee: really?
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:29): but I may be missing something
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:29): how do you start a selection with the keyboard?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:29): (or do you just mean that selection modification shortcuts work once you have a mouse selection)
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:29): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: you get a normal character cursor when you focus on the plain text msg area
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:29): so you can use shift
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:29): shift + arrow keys
ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:31): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I think you need VO on for that to work though
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (03:32): probably, yes

ef6f2287bae00ba79475fbf56c2b6fee (03:39): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: Thinking about it, groups mode provides some of that skipping functionality already (or it would if VO announced "navigation group" rather than just "group") ... it just doesn't handle the jumping to main content bit.
